Power and Poetry: A Showcase of South Korean Cinema
Spectral Visions: the Surreal, Magical, and Fantastic
Uncut Gems: Films by the Safdie Brothers

items.title: 752 Is Not A Number
items.description: Veteran director Babak Payami chronicles Canadian dentist Hamed Esmaeilion’s quest for justice in the aftermath of Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752, shot down in 2020 by the Iranian military.

guests.bio: A Pulitzer Prize, Grammy, Emmy, and Tony Award–winning songwriter, actor, director, and producer, Lin-Manuel Miranda is the creator and original star of Broadway’s Hamilton and In the Heights. In 2015 he was named a MacArthur Fellow, and in 2018 he was a Kennedy Center Honoree. Miranda’s upcoming 2021 films include Disney’s Encanto and his directorial film debut, tick, tick… BOOM!

items.title: Aftersun
items.description: Scottish writer-director Charlotte Wells’ indelible feature debut brims with warmth and quiet wonder as its protagonist recalls a father and daughter’s journey to a Turkish seaside resort some 20 years after the fact.

items.title: Alice, Darling
items.description: Anna Kendrick captures the anxious psychology of a woman in an abusive relationship as her friends try to reconnect with her while on a cottage getaway.

items.title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed
items.description: Academy Award–winning documentarian Laura Poitras chronicles the life and work of famed artist Nan Goldin, including her protests against the Sackler family and their company Purdue Pharma, maker of OxyContin.

items.title: Another Round
items.description: This film will be available to rent on TIFF’s online film platform, digital TIFF Bell Lightbox, starting December 18.

items.title: August 32nd on Earth
webProgrammes: Spectral Visions: the Surreal, Magical, and Fantastic

items.title: Baby Ruby
items.description: The tightly scripted world of a vlogger and influencer (Noémie Merlant, Portrait of a Lady on Fire) unravels after she becomes a mother, in noted playwright Bess Wohl’s feature debut.
